elbow-room.value:
In 1995, the United States of America had 28 people/km^2.
  In 2018, that number was 36 people/km^2 and is projected to be 35 people/km^2 in 2025.

fire.value: Wildfires will occur more frequently in subarctic conifer forests and tundra.
fire.source: Section 28.2.3.1; Mack et al. (2011); Mann et al. (2012)

tree-line.value: Upward trend in tree lines and associated fauna on high-elevation islands
tree-line.source: Section 29.3.2; Benning et al. (2002); Jump et al. (2006)

elbow-room.value:
In 1995, Canada had 3 people/km^2.
  In 2018, that number was 4 people/km^2 and is projected to be 4 people/km^2 in 2025.

indigenous-people.value: A warming climate, a change in snow cover and in sea ice, and evolving economic and sociopolitics will challenge the livelihoods of Arctic indigeous peoples.
indigenous-people.source: Sections 18.4.6 and 28.2.4.2; Table 18-4; Hovelsrud et al. (2008); Ford et al. (2009); Beaumier and Ford (2010); Pearce et al. (2010); Eira (2012); Crate (2013); Mathiesen et al. (2013)
